TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ExportAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Exports a method or property to the Objective-C world.

remarks.para: This attribute is applied to properties and methods in classes that derive from to export the value to the Objective-C world. This can be used either to respond to messages or to override an Objective-C method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Use this method to expose a C# method, property or constructor as a method that can be invoked from Objective-C.
Docs.remarks: Use this method to expose a C# method, property or constructor as a method that can be invoked from Objective-C. The name is derived from the actual method or property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string selector) cil managed

Docs.summary: Exports the given method or property to Objective-C land with the specified method name.
Docs.remarks: Use this method to expose a C# method, property or constructor as a method that can be invoked from Objective-C.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string selector, valuetype MonoMac.ObjCRuntime.ArgumentSemantic semantic) cil managed

Docs.param: The semantics of the setter (Assign, Copy or Retain).
Docs.summary: Use this method to expose a C# method, property or constructor as a method that can be invoked from Objective-C.
Docs.remarks: Use this method to expose a C# method, property or constructor as a method that can be invoked from Objective-C.

Docs.summary: The semantics for object ownership on setter properties or methods.
Docs.value: The assignment ownership semantics for setting the value.

Docs.summary: The name of the C# selector if specified, or null if it is derived from the property name or method.
